tit.e: Gozanha (group of the highest-ranked temples in Zen sect)
Gozanha (group of the highest-ranked temples in the Zen sect)

sen.j: 五山派（ござんは・五山叢林（ござんそうりん）は、五山十刹諸山の制度に組み込まれてその保護・統制下に置かれていた禅宗寺院（禅林）のこと。
sen.e: The Gozanha (Gozansorin) are the Zen temples (Zenrin) which were placed under the protection and control of the Gozan-Jissatsu-Shozan system (system of Five great temples, Ten important temples of Rinzai sect, and Zen temples other than Gozan and Jissatsu).

sen.e: The Gozanha (Gozansorin) are the Zen temples (Zenrin) that were placed under the protection and control of the Gozan-Jissatsu-Shozan system (system of five great temples, ten important temples of the Rinzai sect, and Zen temples other than Gozan and Jissatsu).

The Gozanha (Gozansorin) are the Zen temples (Zenrin) that were placed under the protection and control of the Gozan-Jissetsu-Shozan system (system of five great temples, ten important temples of the Rinzai sect, and Zen temples other than Gozan and Jissetsu).

sen.j: 五山十刹諸山制度は、室町幕府が制定した寺格制度である。
sen.e: The Gozan-Jissatsu-Shozan system was a system of jikaku (status of a Buddhist temple) established by the Muromachi bakufu.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Gozan-Jissatsu-Shozan system was a system of jikaku (status of a Buddhist temple) established by the Muromachi bakufu.
The Gozan-Jissetsu-Shozan system was a system of jikaku (status of a Buddhist temple) established by the Muromachi bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun).

sen.j: 一般的に五山以下の寺格が与えられた寺院が臨済宗であったために「五山派＝臨済宗」と考えられがちであるが、実際には臨済宗でも大応派は五山の支配を受けなかった。
sen.e: As the temples ranked under Gozan were mostly Rinzai sect Buddhist temples, the Gozanha are often taken as the Rinzai sect; however, the Daioha (Daio school), which even belonged to the Rinzai sect, was not controlled by the Gozan system.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Because the temples ranked under Gozan were mostly Buddhist temples of the Rinzai sect, the Gozanha are often taken as the Rinzai sect; however, the Daioha (Daio school), which in turn belonged to the Rinzai sect, wasn't subject to control by the Gozan system.

sen.j: 逆に曹洞宗でも道元との直接的な関係の乏しい中国大陸系の宏智派などは、その保護・統制下に入っていた。
sen.e: On the contrary, Sochiha (Sochi school of Buddhism) of Chinese origin, which was not so directly related to Dogen, was under the control of the Gozan system in spite of belonging to the Soto sect of Zen Buddhism.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Contrastingly, Sochiha (Sochi school of Buddhism) of Chinese origin, which wasn't directly related to Dogen, was under the control of the Gozan system despite belonging to the Soto sect of Zen Buddhism.

sen.j: 足利尊氏の崇敬を受けてきた夢窓疎石のもとで大きく発展し、以後も春屋妙葩・義堂周信・絶海中津などの高僧を輩出して歴代足利将軍の崇敬を受けて、室町幕府の政策にも影響を与えた。
sen.e: The Gozanha flourished under Soseki MUSO whom Takauji ASHIKAGA had paid respect, and eventually produced a lot of high-ranking priests, such as Myoha SHUNOKU, Shushin GIDO, and Chushin ZEKKAI, exerting a great influence on policies of the Muromachi bakufu with reverence by the successive Ashikaga Shoguns.
